title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: Told in Kvothe's own voice, this is the tale of the magically gifted young man who grows to be the most notorious wizard his world has ever seen.

reviews.title: Masterpiece of modern fantasy
reviews.text: This book completely redefined what I expect from fantasy literature. The prose is beautiful, the characters are deep, and the world is incredibly immersive.

reviews.title: Beautiful writing but slow pacing
reviews.text: Rothfuss's writing is absolutely gorgeous, but the story does drag at times. Still, the characters are so compelling that I couldn't put it down.

title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
author: Brandon Sanderson
description: In a world where the Dark Lord has won, a young street thief discovers she has magical powers and teams up with a group of rebels to overthrow the evil empire.

reviews.title: Incredible magic system
reviews.text: Sanderson's Allomancy system is one of the most original and well-thought-out magic systems I've ever encountered. The characters are great and the plot is full of twists.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A woman shoots her husband and then never speaks another word. A criminal psychotherapist tries to unravel the mystery.

reviews.title: Gripping psychological thriller
reviews.text: The twist at the end completely shocked me. The pacing was excellent and the characters were well-developed. Highly recommend for thriller fans.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: When a woman goes missing on her fifth wedding anniversary, her diary reveals hidden turmoil in her marriage, while her husband's behavior becomes increasingly suspicious.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A journalist and a young computer hacker investigate a 40-year-old disappearance, uncovering dark family secrets along the way.

reviews.title: Dark and compelling
reviews.text: Lisbeth Salander is one of the most original characters in modern fiction. The mystery is complex and the Swedish setting adds great atmosphere.

title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: Sherlock Holmes investigates the legend of a supernatural hound that haunts the Baskerville family.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: In a distant future where noble houses control planetary fiefs, young Paul Atreides must lead a rebellion on the desert planet Arrakis.

reviews.title: The greatest sci-fi novel ever
reviews.text: The world-building is unparalleled, the politics are complex, and the characters are unforgettable. A true masterpiece of the genre.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: A lone astronaut must save the earth from disaster in this science-based adventure from the author of The Martian.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings.

reviews.title: The gold standard for horror
reviews.text: King's masterpiece. The slow descent into madness is terrifying and the atmosphere is oppressive. Much better than the movie!

title: The Haunting of Hill House
author: Shirley Jackson
description: Four seekers arrive at a notoriously unfriendly pile called Hill House to study supernatural phenomena and discover that the house is gathering its powers.
